text: hearty winter vegetables are an ideal
partner for holiday centerpieces like a
ham or a beef tenderloin or any kind of
poultry like a chicken or a turkey this
one uses three vegetables cabbage this
is a savoy variety which I like because
it's sweet and mild Brussels sprouts and
rainbow Swiss chard the big secret is
you can eat them all raw start with the
cabbage you'll need about half a head
work around the core you do not have to
remove the core first you'll want about
8 cups total for this recipe the savoy
goes in a bowl the Swiss chard just
remove these stems they're tough but
don't throw them away chop them up and
saute them or roast them they're
excellent pickled and you could use
green or red or white Swiss chard I like
the rainbow just because of the added
color that it brings line up your leaves
it's a bit like rolling a cigar if
you've ever rolled a cigar or seen
someone rolling a cigar take your knife
and straight through that's it very
quick and easy and now for the Brussels
sprouts if you're lucky enough to find
them in your store or farmers market on
the stalk buy them this way they keep
longer and they're so fresh and you
don't have to trim them either you just
pull right off and you have beautiful
Brussels sprouts so you can just thinly
slice these you'll want 8 ounces that's
half a pound now I did say that this is
a raw salad and that is true to a degree
however we are letting the greens break
down in the refrigerator with the
addition of sugar and salt
that doesn't away cook the green so that
they collapse and become tender and
enjoyable to eat and to this a teaspoon
of coarse salt and two teaspoons of
sugar the sugar just helps to balance
the flavors and rub these greens between
your fingers until they're slightly damp
and they need about 30 minutes to an
hour in the refrigerator before we dress
them our greens have been hanging out in
the fridge for about an hour and you can
see they've collapsed darkened slightly
so for the dressing very simple a
teaspoon of coarse salt and a teaspoon
of low-sodium soy sauce yes soy sauce
you won't taste it a soy here in the
salad it just gives that nice saltiness
and 2 teaspoons of
j'onn mustard and my very favorite
vinegar of all sherry vinegar three
tablespoons go in here
ooh well that's two right there already
okay one more good thing this is not
science just whisk that about there's a
lid over the greens toss that all
together that dressing smells fantastic
and for the finishing touches some
cheese pecorino romano it's a bit like
parmesan only a more robust flavor and
you'll want about an ounce of this
walnuts toasted and then chopped don't
be afraid of toasting your walnuts nice
and dark really brings out their flavor
you can always serve these walnuts on
the side this just needs about 10
minutes to hang out on the countertop or
if you're making it ahead pop it in the
fridge and then remove it 30 minutes
before you're gonna serve it so that
it's not too cold and for garnish a
little more pecorino shaved and some
beautiful pieces of toasted walnuts and
there you have it a beautiful side salad
overall cabbage brussel sprouts and
Swiss chard
you
